intro: Hieracium lasiochaetum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with hairy, sometimes reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow, often appearing in clusters at the top of the stems, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium lasiochaetum is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
